page.title: 18RED BARNS
page.content: One of the oldest and most interesting houses in my area is "Red Barns." It was built for Thomas Hugh Bell,an ironmaster,in 1871. It was there that Gertrude Lowthian Bell,the Arabian explorer, spent her childhood. After graduating from Oxford she went to the Middle East,where she took a leading part in the administrative development of Iraq. After the First World War she assisted Lawrence of Arabia by doing propaganda work and became known as Mother of the Faithful. When she died,she was given the funneral of a shiehk. In 1920s "Red Barns" was sold and became the house where the headmaster and the borders of Sir William Turner's Grammar School lived until 1975 when the school closed.The house was sold and became a private hotel.
